member.name: T:Fetch.Api.Utility
member.summary: Static utility functions

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Utility.SerializeToXml(System.Object)
member.summary: Serializes the given object into an XML string. Object must have the SerializableAttribute applied.

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Utility.DeserializeFromXmlStream``1(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Deserializes an object of the generic parameter type from the given stream of XML
member.typeparam: type of the object to deserialize
member.param: XML stream containing the object data

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Utility.DeserializeFromXml``1(System.String)
member.summary: Deserializes an object of the generic parameter type from the given XML string
member.typeparam: type of the object to deserialize

member.name: T:Fetch.Api.Item
member.summary: Item is a model object that mirrors the type used by the Fetch REST API, and contains all the properties and methods offered by the API.

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Item.#ctor
member.summary: default constructor

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Item.Save
member.summary: Commits the current item to Fetch. Item is created if new, or updated if existing.

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Item.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the current item from Fetch.

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Item.RetrieveAll
member.summary: Retrieve all the existing items from Fetch

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Item.Retrieve(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a specific item from Fetch
member.param: The SKU of the Item to retrieve

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Item.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes an item from Fetch
member.param: the SKU of the Item to delete

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Item.Create(Fetch.Api.Item)
member.summary: Creates a new item in Fetch
member.returns: the actual item object that was created by Fetch

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Item.Update(Fetch.Api.Item)
member.summary: Updates the given item in Fetch
member.returns: the actual item object that was updated in Fetch

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Item.Sku
member.summary: unique identifier for this item

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Item.Name
member.summary: friendly name of the item

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Item.DownloadCount
member.summary: number of times this Item has been downloaded from Fetch

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Item.CreatedAt
member.summary: date this item was created

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Item.Filename
member.summary: The name of the file attached to this item

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Item.SizeBytes
member.summary: size in bytes of the file attached to this item

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Item.ContentType
member.summary: type of file attached to this item

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Item.IsNew
member.summary: Gets true if this item has not been committed to Fetch. Gets false if this item already exists in Fetch.

member.name: T:Fetch.Api.ItemCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of items that serializes to match the XML returned by Fetch

member.name: T:Fetch.Api.RestConnection`1
member.summary: sends and receives communications with a RESTful web service using GET and POST.
member.typeparam: the type of object to be deserialized from the response XML the web service returns

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.RestConnection`1.#ctor
member.summary: default constructor

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.RestConnection`1.InvokeGet(System.String)
member.summary: initiates a GET request to the WS, and calls the given method
member.param: name of the method to execute
member.returns: an object deserialized from the XML returned

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.RestConnection`1.InvokeGet(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: initiates a GET request to the WS, and calls the given method with the optional arguments
member.param: name of the method to execute
list of additional arguments to add the the URL
member.returns: an object deserialized from the XML returned

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.RestConnection`1.InvokePut(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: initiates a POST request to the WS to the given method and POSTs the given object, serialized as XML
member.param: name of the method to execute
object to serialize into XML and POST
member.returns: an object deserialized from the XML returned

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.RestConnection`1.InvokePut(System.String,System.Object,System.String[])
member.summary: initiates a POST request to the WS to the given method and optional parameters and POSTs the given object serialized as XML
member.param: name of the method to execute
object to serialize into XML and POST
list of additional arguments to add the the URL
member.returns: an object deserialized from the XML returned

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.RestConnection`1.ThrowWebException(System.Net.WebException)
member.summary: Reads any error messages thrown from the connection, and rethrows the exception w/ the additional information

member.name: T:Fetch.Api.Message
member.summary: Represents messages returned from Fetch REST GET commands that contain results of the opertaion.

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Message.ToString
member.summary: Override ToString

member.name: F:Fetch.Api.Message.OkResponse
member.summary: constant representing a successful response

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Message.Text
member.summary: The body of the message.

member.name: T:Fetch.Api.Order
member.summary: Order is a model object that mirrors the type used by the Fetch REST API, and contains all the properties and methods offered by the API.

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Order.#ctor
member.summary: default constructor

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Order.Save
member.summary: Commits this order data to Fetch. Order is created if new, order is updated if existing.

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Order.Delete
member.summary: Removes this order from Fetch.

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Order.Expire
member.summary: Sets this order to expired, so it may no longer be downloaded.

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Order.SendEmail
member.summary: Forces a send of an email to the customer of this order

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Order.RetrieveAll
member.summary: Retrieve all orders available from Fetch

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Order.Retrieve(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieve a specific order from Fetch
member.param: unique ID of the order to retrieve

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Order.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the given order from Fetch
member.param: unique ID of the order to delete

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Order.Expire(System.String)
member.summary: Expires the given order in Fetch, so it may no longer be downloaded.

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Order.SendEmail(System.String)
member.summary: Forces an email to be sent to the customer

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Order.Create(Fetch.Api.Order)
member.summary: Creates an order in Fetch
member.returns: the actual Order object created by Fetch

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Order.Update(Fetch.Api.Order)
member.summary: Updates an order in Fetch
member.returns: the actual Order object that was updated in Fetch

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Order.SendEmailFlag
member.summary: Gets or Sets whether or not to send an email when this order is created

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Order.Id
member.summary: unique ID of this order

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Order.Title
member.summary: textual description of the order

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Order.FirstName
member.summary: first name of the customer

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Order.LastName
member.summary: last name of the customer

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Order.Email
member.summary: email address of the customer

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Order.ExpirationDate
member.summary: date that this order will expire, and no longer be available for download

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Order.DownloadCount
member.summary: number of times items in this order have been downloaded

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Order.CreatedAt
member.summary: date that this order was created

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Order.OrderItems
member.summary: items that are included in this order

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Order.IsNew
member.summary: Gets true if this order has not been committed to Fetch. Gets false if this order already exists in Fetch.

member.name: T:Fetch.Api.OrderCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of orders that serializes to match the XML returned by Fetch

member.name: T:Fetch.Api.OrderItem
member.summary: object that is used to describe items included in an order

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.OrderItem.Sku
member.summary: unique ID of an item in an order

member.name: T:Fetch.Api.Config
member.summary: Configuration parameters for the connection to Fetch

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.Config.GetAuthorization
member.summary: Retrieves the key/token pair encoded to be sent in a request to authenticate the request

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Config.Subdomain
member.summary: the subdomain used to connect to fetch

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Config.Key
member.summary: Authentication key used to log into the Fetch API. Log in to your Fetch website and click "API" to retrieve your Key and Token.

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.Config.Token
member.summary: Authentication token used to log into the Fetch API. Log in to your Fetch website and click "API" to retrieve your Key and Token.

member.name: T:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1
member.summary: SerializableList is a wrapper for the generic List<> that performs its own serialization, to allow the user to add custom attributes to the list. The .NET Framework List overrides any serialization of properties of a custom list class, so they don't get serialized.
member.typeparam: type of the item in the list

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.#ctor
member.summary: default constructor

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.Add(`0)
member.summary: Add an item to the list

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.Clear
member.summary: Clear all items from the list

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.Contains(`0)
member.summary: Returns true if the given item exists in the list

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.CopyTo(`0[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies the contents of the list into the given array, at the given index

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Remove the given item from the list

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Get the enumerator object from the list

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.System#Collections#IEnumerable#GetEnumerator
member.summary: Get the enumerator object from the list

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.GetSchema
member.summary: Get the Schema for the serialization of this list. Not used.

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.ReadXml(System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Reads data for this list in from the given XmlReader. May be overridden in a derived class to populate custom properties

member.name: M:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.WriteXml(System.Xml.XmlWriter)
member.summary: Writes data from this list into the given XmlWriter. May be overridden in a derived class to write custom properties

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of items in the list

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Returns false

member.name: P:Fetch.Api.SerializableList`1.Attributes
member.summary: A collection of name/value pairs to be written as attributes of the root element of this list
